availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Apprehension of Fugitives from Justice Papers, 1862-1863

body.p:
State of Kentucky
Franklin Co. Sct.

This day T. J. Fisher made oath before me a Justice of the peace for Sd County that on the 15th day of Feby 1863 in the County of Campbell in the State of Ky Wm Fisher a mulatto boy and Mary Ann Malone a mulatto woman of the Said County of Campbell aforesaid, did maliciously & with malace aforethought, Steal take & Carry away from him Sd T. J. Fisher one fine bay horse worth Two Hundred & Fifty dollars & one Carriage & harness of the Value of Two hundred and fifty dollars, both of which were at the time of the Stealing taking & carryiing away aforesaid the property of him the Sd T. J. Fisher & that the Sd Wm Fisher & the sd Mary Ann Malone Colrd persons as aforesaid are guilty of the Crime of Stealing the horse & and the said Carriage & harness afd in and from the County of Campbell & in the State aforesaid. He further states that the Sd Wm Fisher & Mary Ann Malone are now fugitives from the Justice of the State of Ohio and are now in jail in the City of Cincinnati & in the County of Hamilton in Sd State.

Subscribed & Sworn to before me a Justice of the
Peace for Sd County of Franklin by T. J. Fisher this 26th day of Feby 1863.
Geo. W. Gwin J, P. J C.

I Alexr H. Rennick Clerk of the County Court for the County of Franklin do certify that Geo W. Gwin who has signed his Signature to the foregoing certificate was at the time of doing the same a Commonwealths Justice in and for the County of Franklin in the State of Kentucky, duly Commmisioned & qualified & that his Said Signature is genuine & by law is authorized to administrator oaths & that his certificate is in due form of law.
In Testimony whereof I have hereto set my name as Clerk & affixed the Seal of Said Court at office in Frankfort this 26th Feby 1863.

A. H. Rennick Clerk
Franklin Co Court Ky

As Presiding Judge of the Franklin County Court I certify that Alex. H. Rennick who has Signed
the above certificate is Clerk of said Co. Court & that his certificate is in due form of law.
Given under my hand this 26th Feby 1863

I Swigert. Presiding
Judge Franklin Cty.

Ohio
Demand for Wm Harris & Mary Ann Malone
Fugities
Issd Feby 26. 1862
Rev. T. J. Fisher
Agent
